intro: Haplophyllum villosum var. ciscaucasicum, commonly known as the Caucasian hairy bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Caucasus region. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers sunny to partially shaded environments. Its leaves are often covered in fine, soft hairs, contributing to its common name. The flowers are usually blue or purple, adding ornamental value to its natural habitat.
